metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3979 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A key length flaw was found in Red Hat Ceph Storage. An attacker can exploit the fact that the key length is incorrectly passed in an encryption algorithm to create a non random key, which is weaker and can be exploited for loss of confidentiality and integrity on encrypted disks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3979` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.11
